entry.title: New release for Beszel Companion: Release v1.3.0
entry.content:
New Features

Multi-Systems Management

You can now effortlessly manage and monitor different systems within a single system.

  • Streamlined System Management: Gain better control over various systems operating within one hub.
  • Improved Overview: Easily monitor the performance and status of individual systems at a glance.

Home Screen Widgets Enhancements

  • Hub Selection: You can now choose which of your configured Hubs & Systems a widget should display data for directly from the widget configuration.

Fixes & Improvements

Terminology Update

  • "Instance" is now "Hub": To provide a clearer and more intuitive experience, the term "Instance" has been updated to "Hub" throughout the application.

Build Improvements

  • Two IPA files are now provided: one built with the latest SDK 26 for iOS 26 beta users (including new Liquid Glass design), and another built with SDK 18.5 for broader compatibility.

entry.title: New release for Beszel Companion: Release v1.4.0
entry.content:
New Features

Centralized Dashboard per Hub

The home screen now offers a complete and unified overview of the selected hub.

  • All pinned charts for the selected hub are now displayed on the home screen, not just those for the active system.
  • The dashboard intelligently fetches data for all systems with pinned items, ensuring every chart has data to display.

Advanced Filtering & Sorting

Quickly find the charts you need with powerful new search and sorting tools.

  • A new search bar on the home screen allows you to instantly filter charts by system or service name.
  • A dedicated filter menu opens a full-screen modal, letting you sort your pinned charts by system, metric type, or service, in either ascending or descending order.

Fixes & Improvements

Navigation Stability

  • Replaced the legacy NavigationView with the more robust NavigationStack to fix crashes and instability when navigating quickly between views.

UI Polish & Bug Fixes

  • Corrected various vertical and horizontal padding issues on lists for a cleaner, more consistent look.
  • Fixed a critical bug where no data would load if no charts were pinned. The app now always fetches data for the active system.
  • The loading indicator on the System and Container pages is now properly centered.

This update is not currently available on App Store.

entry.title: New release for Beszel Companion: Release v1.4.1
entry.content:
Fixes & Improvements

Sideloading Support

  • Resolved a critical issue that prevented the app from loading data for sideloaded installations. The app now intelligently handles credential storage, ensuring full functionality without requiring users to re-enter passwords.

  • Widget limitation for Sideloaded Apps: Please note that due to iOS security policies, Home Screen widgets will not work on sideloaded versions. For the complete experience, including widgets, we recommend installing the app from the official App Store.

General Stability

  • Refined the underlying logic for managing instance and system switching to improve reliability and prevent errors.

entry.title: New release for Beszel Companion: Release v1.5.0
entry.content:
New Features

This major update focuses on improving the user experience with new authentication features, more powerful charts, and a significant code reorganization to make the app more robust and easier to maintain.

  • Web Login (SSO): You can now connect to your Beszel instances using external authentication providers (like Google, GitHub, etc.), if your instance is configured for it.
  • Stacked Container Charts: Discover new charts on the "Containers" page that display the total CPU and Memory usage for all your Docker containers, giving you an instant overview.
  • Pin Detailed Charts: You can now pin the stacked charts directly from their detailed view to add them to your custom dashboard.

Fixes & Improvements

  • Searching and sorting on the home screen now work correctly, regardless of the app's language.
  • Added a new application icon format (AppIcon.icon) for compatibility with future versions of iOS.

Architecture & Code quality

  • Refactoring the codebase to consistently use the View/ViewModel pattern has improved code clarity and led to a drastic reduction in the application's size.

Support the project

If you find this application useful, you can support its development. However, please consider supporting the original Beszel project first! - Sponsor on GitHub - Buy Me a Coffee
